intro: Capura alata, commonly known as the winged capura, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Capura alata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
